column4: <font color="#ffffff">              Distance:</font> minimum spawn distance (in meters)
<font color="#28a745">                  Levels:</font> lowest allowed (relative to Geralt)

Seconds before an event can trigger again
Event Fill creatures group - allow copy of creatures in combat
No camera scene on horse (ImmersiveCamera compatibility)
Trophy buying price from bounty master (%)
The bounty master is looking for a Witcher, monsters to be killed. Come see him to start bounties and sell your trophies
A monster trophy, the bounty master will probably buy it at a better price.
Delay RER loading start (Bootstrap Hooked compatibility)

You are being Ambushed by monsters or bandits from the mod Random Encounters Reworked. Fight in an attempt to survive the ambush you will be rewarded by trophies and crowns.

If you don't like being ambushed, you can change the amount of ambushes created by the mod and also control exactly what kind of creature you will see from them in the Encounter System menu and the sub-menus for ambushes.

A Bounty hunt from the mod Random Encounters Reworked has just started. A bounty is pretty simple, important groups of creatures are marked on your map. You have to kill every marked groups to finish the bounty, and as you progress through the bounty new marked groups may appear. The bounty continues until there is no more groups to kill.

Everything you see during bounties like the markers and their positions, the creatures that compose the bounties, and how many markers and overall creatures are determined by the seed (the number) that you picked in the seed selector window. Two bounties with the same seed will result in the exact same encounter. But don't worry, there is an almost infinite number of seeds. If you're indecisive about the seed, picking a seed of 0 will make a completely random bounty for you.
Higher seeds result in more difficult bounties. And as you complete bounties you unlock more seeds and thus more difficult bounties.

You may have found bounty notices when killing wild creatures before. These notices are just there to tell you about the bounty master, you can sell them without any hesitation.

You should know that if you use the mod Friendly HUD, the map markers also appear as 3D markers which is really useful.

You just examined a track from the mod Random Encounters Reworked. When you examine a track Geralt will tell what monster it is from, and if you follow the trail you will eventually find the creature that left them.
Almost all creatures from the mod leave tracks on the ground. But be aware that because RER uses voicelines from the game the creature you'll see may not always correspond exactly to what Geralt said. But you can be sure the family will always be the right one. For example Geralt never says NoonWraith and so it will say NightWraith instead, but it's still a wraith so it's ok.

A Monster Contract from the mod Random Encounters Reworked has just started. You may have noticed a camera scene was played and perhaps Geralt talking, from now on and if you want to progress through the monster contract you will have to follow the trails, the map markers the mod placed or where the camera scene guided you.
A monster contract is randomly generated and is composed of small pre-built phases that are combined to form something that could look like a vanilla contract, with less details of-course as it is generated on the fly.
You can control the amount of phases that are used to build the contract, or in other terms, its length with the Longevity slider you can find in the mod menu. One longevity point is roughly equivalent to 1 minute and 30 seconds of gameplay after you're used to the flow of the system.

Some phases are pretty simple and ask you to simply follow a trail or examine the ground, while some others will get you in combat. The monster contract is an encounter where you must be prepared to fight and should be considered as hard, if not harder, than vanilla contracts.

A monster contract lasts until Geralt says the line `It's over`. There are some cases where the mod is not able to find a suitable position or an error occured and the encounter will be shut down and Geralt will once again say the line. So whenever you hear the line `It's over` don't look further because everything about the contract except the loot will soon disappear

Good luck, and if you encounter any bug, have a suggestion or feedback, feel free to contact me!
- Aeltoth

You recently killed a creature and indirectly changed the surrounding ecosystems. The mod Random Encounters Reworked simulates a food chain that will permanently change the creatures you see (only creatures from the mod). Because you killed living creatures or bandits, the surrounding ecosystems changed a little and if you continue new species will come and some other will even migrate to new places.

You can examine the surrounding ecosystem with the Ecosystem Analyse keybind, which will allow you to learn useful information about the species and their habits. To learn how to get the keybind, please refer to the in-depth install guide.

If you do not like the feature you can change its settings in the Ecosystem System menu. As you kill creatures in a single region, the number of creatures will vary depending on your menu settings (by default it will increase): this is called the ecosystem strength. As the ecosystem strength changes the Killing spree loot reward system will unlock new loot table for the creatures and will progressively increase the drop rate of these loot tables. Refer to the RER-Bible to learn more.

A <font color="#CD7D03">Noticeboard Event</font> from the mod Random Encounters Reworked has just started. When you'll close the window Geralt will say a few lines, after that the mod will wait for you to leave the settlement or the city you're in, and once you're far enough a <font color="#CD7D03">Monster Contract</font> will start based on the path you walked.

You just found a Trophy from the mod Random Encounters Reworked. These trophies were created only to reward Geralt for the creatures he hunts and do not have any purpose but to be sold.
Creatures from the mod also drop a few crowns for the same purpose. If you do not like the rewards or would like to change how many you find you can do so in the Rewards System menu specifically made for it.
Delay multiplier when in settlements (1 = no change, 2 = twice longer)
Dynamic creatures size (scales RER creatures based on their level)

The following creatures were seen and now have bounties on their heads:
{{creature_listing}}
Whoever brings their trophies to the bounty master will get a sizable reward
Go see the bounty master to sell your trophies and learn about the new bounties
A group of {{creature_type}} was seen in the area. Kill them and collect their trophies for a reward.
Clues lead to this area, something interesting must be here.
The bounty master bought your trophies for {{crowns_amount}} crowns
Bounty finished, you now have a bounty level of {{bounty_level}}

You just installed the mod Random Encounters Reworked, if you didn't apply the default presets yourself then it did it for you. It means that RER is fully functional and you can go kill some monsters!

You won't see this popup again unless you reset the settings.
The mod will continue to display tutorials as you discover things. If you don't want them, although i (Aeltoth) highly suggest to keep them, you can go in the Tutorials menu and set them OFF.

column1: ; to translators:
; the end is not a typo but simply a random name formed with the letters of Aeltoth, my nickname,
; as a way for users to recognise the notices created by RER but without breaking immersion!
; and the spaces are so the name appears on the right on the notice.

column4:
Good Folk!

There's a vile and dangerous spook, beast or devil of sorts causing no end of trouble near our homes. We promise our profoundest gratitude - and a sizeable reward - to any brave lad who can slay it.

- A. Letoth
Chance to trigger on encounter end (%)
Noticeboard errands to start RER contracts
<font color="#9e9e9e">         Day & Night:</font> Additional delay (in seconds) per player level

Anyone knows how to read, read this, and read it careful, so that it's known far and wide, or at least throughout the whole village.

I was out in the field, hunting for something to eat when i heard the growl. There's a beast that feeds on men, you cannot walk within ten spans of the evil and hope to escape alive. It's thus keeping us from hunting and harvesting our crops, meaning famine and misery await us if nothing changes.
I spied some odd tracks and couldn't for the life of me figure out what left them, even though I've many a hunt under my belt. You know me, I'm not one to make a fuss, but I can't help but reckon they bode ill and we all should be on guard

if you've the courage and skill, slay the monster for us, and your efforts will surely be rewarded.

- A. Letoth
<font color="#9e9e9e">         Day & Night:</font> Effects of kills on delays <font size="11">(+100%: faster, -100%: slower)</font>

To Whom It May Concern:

Let it hereby be known that whoever kills the monsters that's wove their nests near our lands and have taken to killing both men and beasts, will be given a sizable reward. Kill enough beasts, and you'll become famed throughout the lands, and your purse'll be heavy with gold.

- A. Letoth
